title: what fonts are these?
content:
hello, I would like help to try and identify these two fonts, they are originally from an early 90's race car, thank you

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014220429im_/http:/typophile.com/files/industrial%20control%20services%20what%20font_5925.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014220429im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bailey%20ics%20plc%20what%20font_4589.jpg)
author: cb4186

comments.content: Excellent thank you, any ideas what the 'Industrial' font might be? I have been struggling to find one that has the correct looking 'C'

Since its lettering on a racecar, there may be some variation from the original font. The closest I can find is [Congress Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014220429/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/congress/black/) Designed by Adrian Williams published by Linotype in 1980.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014220429im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CongressBlack_5263.jpg)
  
The counters aka bowls in Congress Black have a more rounded appearance than your lettering, which has something of boxy or squarish effect. I also note that your lettering is wider than Congress Black.  
Don

The Elsner+Flake version is very similar to the Linotype but matches at the  
 [Extra Bold weight](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014220429/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/congress/ef-extra-bold/) instead of heavy.  
Don

Found it. Should be [Proteus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014220429/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/proteus/).

EDIT: Found it too late.
That's great, thank you for your help
